overview_of_class:
This course covers the evolution of the Earth's dynamic systems and its record through geological time. Emphasis of the course is on the evolution of life as determined from the evidence of the fossil record.

Topics include the discovery and development of the geological time scale, the basic principles of geochronology, stratigraphic and radiometric dating, the evolution of life, climate, and the changing position of continents through time. Such problems as the Cambrian explosion and mass extinctions are featured.
name: Earth System History

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Understanding of geological time, paleontology, and the importance of fossils is the main emphasis of the course.
